did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.repository: Special Collections and Archives, James Branch Cabell Library, Virginia Commonwealth University
did.abstract: The collection (1919- ) consists of administrative files, correspondence, reports, memoranda, committee files, publications, audio tapes, photographs and clippings pertaining to the Richmond First Club's activities or interests.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: Collection is open for use without restrictions

userestrict.head: Literary Property Rights
userestrict.p: Virginia Commonwealth University has a signed Deed of Gift transerring these rights.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Box/Folder, RADA--Richmond First Club Archives, M 238, Special Collection and Archives, James Branch Cabell Library, Virginia Commonwealth University

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Revised: January 1989; March 1989; October 1990; March 1994; November 2000

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical Information
bioghist.p: Organized in 1919, the Richmond First Club was founded by Dr. Dice R. Anderson and B. Roy Dudley, Jr. to continue the work begun by the Richmond Civic Association. Strictly non-partisan, closed to employees and officials of the city, the RFC engages in objective studies of the city's government and offers suggestions for improvements. A more specific history can be found in "A Seventy-Five Year Participation in Local Government: Richmond-First Club 1919-1994" by John H. Whaley.

The Presidents of the Club have been: (* denotes deceased)
Jesse F. Wood 1919-1920*
Stuart Ragland 1920-1921*
B. Roy Dudley, Jr. 1921-1922*
Wilmer L. O'Flaherty 1922-1923*

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Information
scopecontent.p: The Richmond First Club Papers consist of administrative files, correspondence, reports, memoranda, committee files, publications, audio tapes, photographs and clippings about the Club's activities or interests. The materials encompass the years 1919-2000, but are concentrated in the period from the mid 1970s through the present. Series VIII contains photocopied material from the Raymond Pinchbeck Papers at the Virginia Baptist Historical Society. The bulk of these materials are dated from the 1950s.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The majority of the files are arranged alphabetically and then chronologically. Bulletins are arranged by date. Duplicates have been weeded from the collection and either returned to the Richmond First Club or disposed of. Photographs, video tapes and audio cassette tapes have been transferred to RG 60, 70 and M 15 respectively. The oversized materials are maps of the Richmond area of the 1980s.

arrangement.head: Organization
